metadata.title: CVE-2016-2178 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The dsa_sign_setup function in crypto/dsa/dsa_ossl.c in OpenSSL through1.0.2h does not properly ensure the use of constant-time operations, whichmakes it easier for local users to discover a DSA private key via a timingside-channel attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
